pr_title: Implement access token context encoding framework

droid_analysis.notes: Droid correctly identified both bugs with no false positives. However, for the isAccessTokenId bug, droid only caught the inverted logic but missed that the substring indices were also wrong (3,5 should be 4,6).

golden_analysis.notes: Golden identified both bugs but also included 2 code quality suggestions (Javadoc wording, exception type) that are not functional bugs. Golden was more thorough on the isAccessTokenId bug, identifying both the inverted logic AND the wrong substring indices.

qualitative_observations: Both systems performed well on this PR, catching all real bugs
Droid had perfect precision (no false positives) while golden included 2 non-bug suggestions
Golden was more thorough on the isAccessTokenId bug, catching both the logic inversion AND the wrong substring indices
Golden's 2 false positives were legitimate code quality suggestions, just not functional bugs
The bugs in this PR were relatively straightforward to detect through code review
